main event: Observation of silver objects resembling discs and globes in the sky over New York, New York, on October 2, 1956.
interesting points: The observation lasted between 12 to 15 minutes., Many silver objects were seen turning and climbing slowly out of sight., The objects were possibly misidentified aircraft according to the evaluation., The observation was conducted through ground radar and visual means., The file indicates a later closure stating the objects were of a meteorological nature.
sighted object: silver objects resembling discs and globes
